nodes.bodyText:
This will return "true" or "false" as string.
Why not producing a more convenient string status, maybe something similar to the xDSL status ?
Or return boolean and use a Switch channel rather than a String channel ?
You consider the field sfp_present but are we sure that the other fields like sfp_has_signal or link are not better candidates ? (unfortunately the API is not documented !)
This was more intended to introduce a quick running solution to solve F.O. issue. I plan a wider review later on this binding to introduce other field and switch to UoM

Why not using boolean rather than Boolean ?
Same for other Boolean fields.

+package org.openhab.binding.freebox.internal.api.model;
+
+/**
+ * The {@link FreeboxFtthStatus} is the Java class used to map the "FtthStatus"
+ * structure used by the response of the connection Ftth status API
+ * https://dev.freebox.fr/sdk/os/connection/#
+ *
+ * @author Gaël L'hopital - Initial contribution
+ */
+public class FreeboxFtthStatus {
+    private Boolean sfp_present;

nodes.bodyText:
Could you please use standard naming, getSfpPresent rather than getSfp_present ?
Same for the other getter methods.
Please update from String to Switch.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -129,6 +129,7 @@ The following channels are supported:
 | server        | sambafileshare_status    | Switch    | RW          | Indicates whether Window File Sharing  is enabled                               |
 | server        | sambaprintershare_status | Switch    | RW          | Indicates whether Window Printer Sharing  is enabled                            |
 | server        | xdsl_status              | String    | R           | Status of the xDSL line                                                         |
+| server        | ftth_status              | String    | R           | Status of the Ftth line                                                         |

nodes.bodyText:
Please update from String to Switch for item Freebox_ftth_status  and suppress [%s].
For the item Freebox_xdsl_status, rather use xDSL in the label as it could be a VDSL connection or a ADSL connection.
Please update the return type from Boolean to boolean
Please update the return type from Boolean to boolean
What about nullness annotations in the new classes?

nodes.bodyText:
This is a very old binding without nullness annotations.
And the class you point  is an object for JSON mapping, The nonnull annotation is not very appropriate for such case.
